name: AWS Simple Systems Manager
description: This app integrates with AWS Simple Systems Manager (SSM) to remotely and securely manage the configuration of any EC2 instance or on-premises machine configured for SSM

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
Runs shell script command(s) on one or more managed instances

instance_ids.description: Comma(,) separated instance IDs where the command should run. You can specify a maximum of 50 IDs

platform_type.description: The operating system of the instance

commands.description: Comma(,) separated commands to be executed on the instance(s)

working_directory.description: The path to the working directory on your instance

timeout_seconds.description: If this time is reached and the command has not already started running, it will not run

comment.description: User-specified information about the command, such as a brief description of what the command should do

output_s3_bucket_name.description: The name of the S3 bucket where command execution responses should be stored

output_s3_key_prefix.description: The directory structure within the S3 bucket where the responses should be stored

actions.description: Runs command using a public or custom SSM Document on one or more managed instances

instance_ids.description: Comma(,) separated instance IDs where the command should run. You can specify a maximum of 50 IDs

document_name.description: The name of the Systems Manager document to run. This can be a public document or a custom document

document_hash.description: The Sha256 or Sha1 hash created by the system when the document was created

parameters.description: The required and optional parameters specified in the document being run. Example: {"commands": ["ls"]}

working_directory.description: The path to the working directory on your instance

timeout_seconds.description: If this time is reached and the command has not already started running, it will not run

comment.description: User-specified information about the command, such as a brief description of what the command should do

output_s3_bucket_name.description: The name of the S3 bucket where command execution responses should be stored

output_s3_key_prefix.description: The directory structure within the S3 bucket where the responses should be stored

actions.description: Lists the commands ran by users of the AWS account

command_id.description: If provided, lists only the specified command

instance_id.description: Lists commands issued against this instance ID

max_results.description: The maximum number of items to return for this call

next_token.description: The token for the next set of items to return

example_values: Status: Successfully retrieved commands, Next token: 

actions.description: Get information about a parameter by using the parameter name

name.description: The name of the parameter that you want to query

with_decryption.description: Check to decrypt values of secure string parameters. This flag is ignored for String and StringList parameter types

actions.description: Adds a parameter to the AWS account's Parameter Store
actions.verbose:
Parameter Naming Constraints:
  • Parameter names are case sensitive.
  • A parameter name must be unique within an AWS Region
  • A parameter name can't be prefixed with "aws" or "ssm" (case-insensitive).
  • Parameter names can include only the following symbols and letters: a-zA-Z0-9_.-/
  • A parameter name can't include spaces.
  • Parameter hierarchies are limited to a maximum depth of fifteen levels.
  • The maximum length for the fully qualified parameter name is 1011 characters.

name.description: The fully qualified name of the parameter that you want to add to the system. Please refer to app documentation page for naming restrictions

description.description: Information about the parameter that you want to add to the system. Optional but recommended

value.description: The parameter value that you want to add to the system. Standard parameters have a value limit of 4 KB. Advanced parameters have a value limit of 8 KB

type.description: The type of parameter that you want to add to the system. Items in StringList must be seperated by a comma (,). SecureString parameters must use an AWS KMS Key ID

key_id.description: The KMS Key ID that you want to use to encrypt a SecureString parameter. Defaults to the AWS KMS key automatically assigned to your AWS account if no key ID is provided

allowed_pattern.description: A regular expression used to validate the parameter value. For example, for String types with values restricted to numbers, you can specify the following: AllowedPattern=^d+$
